item.title: How To Disable The dGPU On The MSI Delta 15
item.description: Background # If you’re like me and have got an Msi Delta 15 or similar Msi laptop with a dGPU, you can probably disable it to get way more battery life, since even light apps can randomly cause it to turn on for no reason.

item.title: Nintendo Switch Modding
item.description: Checking If The Console Was Patched # A while ago, I became keen to experiment on my V1 Switch which I got in around 2018, and since it was just sitting in my closet gathering dust, I decided to play around with the software and see if I could get homebrew working.

item.title: Logitech G923 Deep Dish Mod (+ Shifter Mods)
item.description: Introduction # This is an older project, as I’ve since lost most of my interest in sim-racing and driving thanks to getting my Learners License in real life.

item.title: Customizing a $30 Amazon Keyboard!
item.description: Introduction # Recently, I picked up a HK Gaming GK61 from Amazon.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Gaming: # I love playing all sorts of games, ranging from Racing/Driving Sims, to FPS’, to Japanese Anime and Visual Novel games.

item.title: Entry-Level Hardtail Upgrades!
item.description: Introduction # So, I recently picked up a Marin Bobcat Trail 3 to get into mountain biking.

item.title: PC Upgrading Throughout The Years
item.description: Beginning # Back in around Q3 2020, my old ROG GL552VW gaming laptop with a 960M and i7 6700HQ was starting to get really slow, and unable to play newer games at the 60fps mark, and struggling to even get 30fps in some cases – which is why I decided to build my pc: I already had most of my peripherals prior to the PC, such as the Corsair K68 Red keyboard I picked up during my Osu phase.
